citeinfo.title: SCHOOLS_HAZUS_IN: Schools in Indiana, Derived from HAZUS (Federal Emergency Management Agency, Point Shapefile)
citeinfo.othercit: This shapefile was derived from a predecessor shapefile, named "SCHOOL.SHP," which was from a shapefile (named "EFSCHOOL.SHP") provided by the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) and the National Institute of Building Sciences (NIBS). EFA was included on a CD-ROM (titled "HAZUS99, Central US") that is the product of a program referred to as "HAZUS, The FEMA Tool for Estimating Earthquake Losses." The original shapefile has been modified by personnel of the IGS. These metadata were created by personnel of IGS, using information included in the HAZUS user's manuals.

descript.abstract: SCHOOLS_HAZUS_IN is a point shapefile that shows locations of school buildings in Indiana. In addition to public and private schools and universities, the shapefile contains locations of preschools, trade schools, language schools, hair-styling schools, obedience schools, and others. SCHOOLS_HAZUS_IN was derived from a shapefile named "SCHOOLS.SHP." A predecessor shapefile of SCHOOLS, named "EFSCHOOLS.SHP," was obtained by the Indiana Geological Survey (IGS) from the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) and the National Institute of Building Sciences (NIBS). The shapefile was included on a CD-ROM (titled "arcHAZUS97, Eastern US") that is the product of a program referred to as "HAZUS, The FEMA Tool for Estimating Earthquake Losses." The original shapefile (referred to as "EFSCHOOLS.SHP") has been modified by personnel of the IGS. This metadata was created by personnel of IGS, using information included in the HAZUS user's manuals. Data for the predecessor shapefile was obtained from a FEMA Database (1992) (HAZUS99, Technical and User Manuals, Appendices.pdf, Appendix D, Summary of Inventory Databases.)
descript.purpose: The predecessor shapefile ("EFSCHOOLS.SHP") was produced by FEMA and NIBS to serve as supplemental data for use by HAZUS, a software tool for estimating earthquake losses. That predecessor shapefile was then modified by personnel of IGS to provide a GIS layer that could be included within the GIS repository of IGS.

idinfo.native: ESRI ArcView version 3.2 shapefile format, approximately 612 Kb

attracc.attraccr: Unknown. No records exist at the Indiana Geological Survey regarding the attribute accuracy of this shapefile. However, reviewers for the Indiana Geological Survey discovered that addresses in the attribute table are not complete for every school or institution listed. A cursory comparison was made between this shapefile and an shapefile of school locations obtained from the Environmental Systems Research Institute (ESRI). There were many points that appeared on the HAZUS shapefile that did not appear on the ESRI shapefile, and vice versa. For more information, contact HAZUS Technical Support: ph: 800-955-9442, fax: 404-261-0117 (attn: HAZUSHELP), e-mail: hazushelp@durtech.com.

dataqual.logic: Unknown. No records exist at the Indiana Geological Survey regarding the logical consistency of this shapefile. For more information, contact HAZUS Technical Support: ph: 800-955-9442, fax: 404-261-0117 (attn: HAZUSHELP), e-mail: hazushelp@durtech.com.
dataqual.complete: Unknown. No records exist at the Indiana Geological Survey regarding the completeness of this shapefile. A cursory comparison was made between this shapefile and an shapefile of school locations obtained from the Environmental Systems Research Institute (ESRI). There were many points that appeared on the HAZUS shapefile that did not appear on the ESRI shapefile, and vice versa. For more information, contact HAZUS Technical Support: ph: 800-955-9442, fax: 404-261-0117 (attn: HAZUSHELP), e-mail: hazushelp@durtech.com.

horizpa.horizpar: Unknown. No records exist at the Indiana Geological Survey regarding the horizontal positional accuracy of this shapefile. A cursory comparison was made between this shapefile and an shapefile of school locations obtained from the Environmental Systems Research Institute (ESRI). However, where the same facilities appeared on both HAZUS and ESRI, there were sometimes spatial displacements of as much as 3 miles. These displacements were not systematic (i.e., they occurred in various directions and with various displacements), indicating that they are the result of the method by which the data points were originally identified and located (such as the "geocoding" method), rather than some consequence of the method of projection. For more information, contact HAZUS Technical Support: ph: 800-955-9442, fax: 404-261-0117 (attn: HAZUSHELP), e-mail: hazushelp@durtech.com.

vertacc.vertaccr: The vertical positional accuracy was not a factor in the production of this shapefile.

citeinfo.title: HAZUS, The FEMA Tool for Estimating Earthquake Losses

pubinfo.publish: Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA); National Institute of Building Sciences (NIBS)

srcinfo.srccontr: The data contained within EFSCHOOLS.SHP were used to generate a shapefile named "SCHOOLS.SHP."

procstep.procdesc: A shapefile named "EFSCHOOLS.SHP" was obtained from the CD-ROM titled "arcHAZUS97, Eastern US" by personnel of the Indiana Geological Survey (IGS). The shapefile was opened in ESRI ArcView. Within ESRI ArcView, the projection was set to UTM NAD83, Zone 16. The original shapefile was then converted to another shapefile (named "SCHOOLS.SHP") by using the "Convert to Shapefile" utility of ESRI ArcView. The Table Edit function of ESRI ArcView was then used to drop the following fields: District, Contact, Mapping, Bldg_type, Designlvl, Bias, Foundation, Year_b, Cost, Bu_pwr, Function, Num_studnt, Area, Shlt_cap, Kitchen, Elevat, Lat, Long, Geores, County, and Comment.
The shapefile named "SCHOOLS" was clipped to INCLP83, a boundary coverage for the State of Indiana (compiled at a scale of 1:24,000). The resulting shapefile was named "SCHOOLS_HAZUS_IN."

This metadata was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (United States Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."

attr.attrdef: Street address of school (Note: Not all addresses are complete.)

edom.edomvd: School other than college or university

metainfo.metuc: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It should not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.
